title: Willamette Valley Multifunctional Plant List
text:
Welcome!

As people dedicated to plants, biodiversity, and healthy ecosystems, we hope these plant lists enhance your backyards, gardens, farms, and landscapes across the Willamette Valley.
Please write more of an introduction here, explaining the elements the data tables contain, how to use the data tables, and any other helpful information about the project.
Do you have a few pictures we could add here? Here’s an example.


Contributors

Jude Hobbs, Heiko Koester, Nick Routledge, Joshua Smith, Rick Valley, and Taylor Zeigler.
I can add links to your respective websites like I did for mine below. Just let me know which links you’d like to use.

Developer

Alex Dallman

title: Medicinal Plants

title: Willamette Valley Multifunctional Plant List
text:
import gspread
from oauth2client.service_account import ServiceAccountCredentials
import pandas as pd


#Setup for Google Drive and Google Sheets API
#Need to create a service account in Google Cloud to get the JSON key: https://console.cloud.google.com/iam-admin/serviceaccounts
#Need to enable Google Sheets and Google Drive APIs for the JSON key to work

scope = ["https://spreadsheets.google.com/feeds",'https://www.googleapis.com/auth/spreadsheets',"https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.file","https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive"]
creds = ServiceAccountCredentials.from_json_keyfile_name('willamete-valley-plant-list-9d764982f071.json', scope)
client = gspread.authorize(creds)


#Load data from Google Sheets
sheet = client.open("Willamette Valley Multifunctional Plant List").sheet1
data = sheet.get_all_records()
df_fruit_trees = pd.DataFrame(data)


pd.set_option('display.max_columns', None)


df_fruit_trees.set_index("Botanical name", inplace=True)
df_fruit_trees.index.name = None 

df_fruit_trees
